summary: Mallatobuck, or “Malla”, was Chewbacca’s wife. She first met Chewbacca when she was younger, and after seeing him perform an...
body:
Mallatobuck, or “Malla”, was Chewbacca’s wife. She first met Chewbacca when she was younger, and after seeing him perform an impressive jump, knew she wanted to marry him. Malla was an accomplished cook and made sure to keep her home in good order while Chewbacca’s life debt to Han Solo kept him from home.

Source: The Star Wars Holiday Special (1978)

summary: I recently did a Reylo song meta, titled, "Ghost BC & Reylo?", making my case that the song "Cirice" should be a Reylo song....
body:
Anakin Skywalker: The Unforgiven

I recently did a Reylo song meta, titled, “Ghost BC & Reylo?”, making my case that the song “Cirice” should be a Reylo song. Now, I’ve been a big Metallica fan my whole life, and my reinvigorated interest in Star Wars in 2018 has gotten me thinking about how much the Black Album classic “The Unforgiven” reminds me of one Anakin Skywalker aka Darth Vader.

“The Unforgiven”

New blood joins this earth,

And quickly he’s subdued.

Through constant pained disgrace

The young boy learns their rules.

(Young Anakin’s early years include slavery on Tatooine)

With time the child draws in.

This whipping boy done wrong.

Deprived of all his thoughts

The young man struggles on and on he’s known

(The former slave becomes a Jedi, where he struggles to bury his passions and emotions)

A vow unto his own,

That never from this day

His will they’ll take away.

(After his mother’s death, Anakin vows to be the most powerful Jedi ever)

What I’ve felt,

What I’ve known

Never shined through in what I’ve shown.

Never be.

Never see.

Won’t see what might have been.

(Anakin was shown a possible future of Padme’s death, and in the same token will never see what her life could of been)

What I’ve felt,

What I’ve known

Never shined through in what I’ve shown.

Never free.

Never me.

So I dub thee unforgiven.

(Anakin’s choices that led him to become Darth Vader strip him of his freedom, his identify, and his honor, making him forever Unforgiven)

They dedicate their lives

To running all of his.

He tries to please them all –

This bitter man he is.

(Darth Vader is a puppet to the Empire, a shell of the once great warrior)

Throughout his life the same –

He’s battled constantly.

This fight he cannot win –

A tired man they see no longer cares.

(After many years fighting for the Emperor and his Empire, Vader has all but given up on his Anakin identity: all he has is the Empire)

The old man then prepares

To die regretfully –

That old man here is me.

(Anakin dies redeemed)

[Guitar solo and repeat chorus]

Anakin Skywalker’s sad legacy lives on in the formation of the First Order and his grandson, Ben Solo aka Kylo Ren. Let’s hope his grandson turns it around in EpIX!

@clairen45 @antbee17 @glitzescape @akylodarkly83

by SpellCleaver

When Luke’s aunt and uncle are executed by order of the Emperor’s right hand, Lord Vader, he flees his home to search for his sister and the mother he never knew. But then Obi-Wan Kenobi stows away about the same ship, Vader gives chase, and Luke is dragged into a conflict that his family are at the very heart of.

summary: Yule reflection: Displaying cherished memories, more than just figures
title: Yule reflection: Displaying cherished memories, more than just figures
body:
People interact with their chosen fandoms in a variety of ways. For me, my main avenues of expressing my fandom interests, other than directly watching the source films/shows, are reading books, writing fanfiction, and collecting figures. Reading and writing are process I enjoy to improve my skills as a writing, a past time I am very passionate about. Those are more internal processes. However, figure collecting is probably one of my few outward displays of fandom (besides my many starwars shirts) and perhaps one that might seem superficial to someone who is not into collecting things themselves. As I was decorating my room for Yule this year, I was looking at the how the Christmas lights were illuminating some of my figures, and it made me reflect on why I had placed some of my figures the way that I did. And then I realized, that much like someone’s album of photos was more than the actual printed ink and paper, my figures were more than just colored plastic representing characters I liked. Like an album of photos, many of my figures remind me of a cherished memory, and subconsciously I had placed many of those figures more prominently on display on my mantelpiece and shelf.

To celebrate the beginning of the Yule season, allow me to share a few of my (mostly star wars) figures and why they are so much more to me than just painted plastic in cardboard boxes.

1. Vacation minion pop figures

Despicable Me/ the minion movies have always been a bonding thing for me and my mom (who is my best friend in the world). I have been living overseas for a few years, and my mom has come over to Europe twice in the past four years. Each time we ended up watching one of the Despicable Me movies when it came out in the cinema, because we think the minions are just so darn cute. We saw the Minion Movie in her hometown in Wuerzburg, Germany and then two years later, we watched Despicable Me 3 at Westfield London when she stayed with me and I showed her around London for a few days. I remember thinking how cute the two minions dressed for vacation were in Despicable Me 3, and when I saw them as Pop figures (I think I got them in York, where a store was having by one Pop and get another one half off deal), I had to get them. They invoke both the nostalgic feelings I have for summer in general and remind me of those four days I spent with my mother in London, which were some of the happiest days of my life so far.  

2. TFA Rey and Kylo Ren target exclusives

These were Target exclusives that my parents sent me as a Christmas present. Rey and Kylo’s relationship has fascinated me ever since my first viewing of tfa, and I have tried to get every Rey and Kylo black series figure in existence. These figures are a lovely set, and I was happy that my parents got these for me as I could not get them in the UK at the time. This set makes me think about Christmas time in general, my parents and I sharing gifts, and the Christmas season when I first watched tfa with my friend and her husband from uni. I make sure to display my Kylo and Rey figures together (and have paired most of the figures up from each set of black and elite series) so nobody can deny that I am a proud OG reylo shipper. <3

3. Thrawn black series figure

Up until earlier this year, I had spent almost 3 years in London living in a very tiny bedroom that was actually meant to be a storage room. It was cheap but mentally challenging to live there (especially the winter when my bedroom became mouse infested and I just had to get used to sleep through the sounds of mice gnawing through plastic bags and seeing them climbing up my clothes in the corner of my eye.) I now live in a much nice place and I have room to have all of my figures out on shelves. In the previous place, I had most of my figures stuffed in the upper part of my wardrobe. I really only had room for one figure out on the small table by my bed. Thrawn was the figure who got that honor. I grew really attached to Thrawn after reading Zahn’s new canon novel, and then going back to re-read the legends Thrawn trilogy. Thrawn was a character who really helped me during a difficult period in my life, and there were some days that reading Zahn’s books on the tube was only way I could get myself to go to work. I am in a better place now with a lot of things, but Thrawn is still one of my absolute favorites, and is the figure on my mantelpiece along with my rey and kylo target exclusives.

4. Star Wars Celebration 2016 Kylo Ren exclusive

I would not have met my friend, Rachael @starwarsnonsense if it wasn’t for how keen I was to get this exclusive Kylo Ren figure when sw celebration was in London in 2016. I only went on the Sunday that year (had to work most of those days and got the ticket last minute) and that year I mostly keen to go add to my growing star wars figure collection. I was originally going to head to the convention center (which was on the opposite side of London from where I lived) later in the morning, but then I read about the limited number of the Kylo exclusives and that you would have to queue for a voucher. So I got up at 3am, took the nightbus from West London, and I will always remember when Rachael walked on the nightbus in Trafalgar square. As the bus filled up with more and more people in star wars shirts, she asked if she could sit next to me, we started chatting about star wars, and the rest was history. This figure is one of my favorites because it is an exclusive, and because I really like Kylo Ren, but it also brings back the memory of that incredible day I had at Celebration London (where I also got to meet Carrie Fisher!) 

5. Director Krennic black series figure

I waited a bit after Rogue One to get Krennic, but unfortunately he was sold out everywhere. On a trip to Ireland, I found Krennic in Forbidden Planet, Dublin, and now he reminds me of that lovely city and the excellent Guinness that I drank there! (I bet Krennic would like Guinness).

6. Vampire minion

It is sooo cute!! The vampire was my mom and me’s favorite minion in the flashback sequence at the beginning of the minion movie. While we were in Germany together, I got these surprise packs of minion characters. I got two of the vampire minion, so I gave one to my mom. She has one on her shelf and I have one on mine. A lot like friendship bracelets, except with cute minions.

7.General Hux black series figure

I remember the trouble it took to get my first Hux figure. There was a period in early 2016ish when the Hux black series figures where sold out everywhere. Later that year they came back in stock, but I wanted Hux asap!! So I ordered him from Korea (which is another place I used to live coincidentally)! This figure reminds me of starting @huxfanblog, and writing my first few hux posts hoping anyone would be interested!

Do you collect anything that reminds you of special memories? Share in the comments! :)

2. TFA Rey and Kylo Ren target exclusives

These were Target exclusives that my parents sent me as a Christmas present. Rey and Kylo’s relationship has fascinated me ever since my first viewing of tfa, and I have tried to get every Rey and Kylo black series figure in existence. These figures are a lovely set, and I was happy that my parents got these for me as I could not get them in the UK at the time. This set makes me think about Christmas time in general, my parents and I sharing gifts, and the Christmas season when I first watched tfa with my friend and her husband from uni. I make sure to display my Kylo and Rey figures together (and have paired most of the figures up from each set of black and elite series) so nobody can deny that I am a proud OG reylo shipper. <3

3. Thrawn black series figure

Up until earlier this year, I had spent almost 3 years in London living in a very tiny bedroom that was actually meant to be a storage room. It was cheap but mentally challenging to live there (especially the winter when my bedroom became mouse infested and I just had to get used to sleep through the sounds of mice gnawing through plastic bags and seeing them climbing up my clothes in the corner of my eye.) I now live in a much nice place and I have room to have all of my figures out on shelves. In the previous place, I had most of my figures stuffed in the upper part of my wardrobe. I really only had room for one figure out on the small table by my bed. Thrawn was the figure who got that honor. I grew really attached to Thrawn after reading Zahn’s new canon novel, and then going back to re-read the legends Thrawn trilogy. Thrawn was a character who really helped me during a difficult period in my life, and there were some days that reading Zahn’s books on the tube was only way I could get myself to go to work. I am in a better place now with a lot of things, but Thrawn is still one of my absolute favorites, and is the figure on my mantelpiece along with my rey and kylo target exclusives.

4. Star Wars Celebration 2016 Kylo Ren exclusive

I would not have met my friend, Rachael @starwarsnonsense if it wasn’t for how keen I was to get this exclusive Kylo Ren figure when sw celebration was in London in 2016. I only went on the Sunday that year (had to work most of those days and got the ticket last minute) and that year I mostly keen to go add to my growing star wars figure collection. I was originally going to head to the convention center (which was on the opposite side of London from where I lived) later in the morning, but then I read about the limited number of the Kylo exclusives and that you would have to queue for a voucher. So I got up at 3am, took the nightbus from West London, and I will always remember when Rachael walked on the nightbus in Trafalgar square. As the bus filled up with more and more people in star wars shirts, she asked if she could sit next to me, we started chatting about star wars, and the rest was history. This figure is one of my favorites because it is an exclusive, and because I really like Kylo Ren, but it also brings back the memory of that incredible day I had at Celebration London (where I also got to meet Carrie Fisher!) 

5. Director Krennic black series figure

I waited a bit after Rogue One to get Krennic, but unfortunately he was sold out everywhere. On a trip to Ireland, I found Krennic in Forbidden Planet, Dublin, and now he reminds me of that lovely city and the excellent Guinness that I drank there! (I bet Krennic would like Guinness).

6. Vampire minion

It is sooo cute!! The vampire was my mom and me’s favorite minion in the flashback sequence at the beginning of the minion movie. While we were in Germany together, I got these surprise packs of minion characters. I got two of the vampire minion, so I gave one to my mom. She has one on her shelf and I have one on mine. A lot like friendship bracelets, except with cute minions.

7.General Hux black series figure

I remember the trouble it took to get my first Hux figure. There was a period in early 2016ish when the Hux black series figures where sold out everywhere. Later that year they came back in stock, but I wanted Hux asap!! So I ordered him from Korea (which is another place I used to live coincidentally)! This figure reminds me of starting @huxfanblog, and writing my first few hux posts hoping anyone would be interested!

Do you collect anything that reminds you of special memories? Share in the comments! :)
